panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

matcher.options: /6h Degradation SLO \(5% of monthly error budget\).*/
/1h Outage SLO \(2% of monthly error budget\).*/

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: webservice Service Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{type="webservice"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{type="webservice"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",type="webservice"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{type="webservice"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",type="webservice"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_30m{type="webservice"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",type="webservice"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_6h{type="webservice"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",type="webservice"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

matcher.options: /6h Degradation SLO \(5% of monthly error budget\).*/
/1h Outage SLO \(2% of monthly error budget\).*/

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: webservice Service Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{type="webservice"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{type="webservice"} > on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",type="webservice"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{type="webservice"} > on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",type="webservice"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_30m{type="webservice"} > on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",type="webservice"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_6h{type="webservice"} > on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",type="webservice"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: graphql_query SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

A GraphQL query is executed in the context of a request. An error does not
always result in a 5xx error. But could contain errors in the response.
Mutliple queries could be batched inside a single request.

This SLI counts all operations, a succeeded operation does not contain errors in
it's response or return a 500 error.

The number of GraphQL queries meeting their duration target based on the urgency
of the endpoint. By default, a query should take no more than 1s. We're working
on making the urgency customizable in [this epic](https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/5841).

We're only taking known operations into account. Known operations are queries
defined in our codebase and originating from our frontend.
panels.title: Details

panels.content:
### Description

Aggregation of most web requests that pass through the puma to the GitLab rails monolith.
Healthchecks are excluded.



### Observability Tools

panels.title: workhorse SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

Aggregation of most rails requests that pass through workhorse, monitored via the HTTP interface.
Excludes API requests, git requests, health, readiness and liveness requests. Some known slow requests,
such as HTTP uploads, are excluded from the apdex score.



### Observability Tools
panels.title: Details

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

matcher.options: /6h Degradation SLO \(5% of monthly error budget\).*/
/1h Outage SLO \(2% of monthly error budget\).*/

1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: workhorse_api SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

Aggregation of most API requests that pass through workhorse, monitored via the HTTP interface.

The workhorse API apdex has a longer apdex latency than the web to allow for slow API requests.



### Observability Tools
panels.title: Details

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

matcher.options: /6h Degradation SLO \(5% of monthly error budget\).*/
/1h Outage SLO \(2% of monthly error budget\).*/

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: workhorse_git SLI Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_apdex:confidence:ratio_1h{component="workhorse_git",confidence="98%",type="webservice"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:confidence:ratio_5m{component="workhorse_git",confidence="98%",type="webservice"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="workhorse_git",type="webservice"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:confidence:ratio_1h{component="workhorse_git",confidence="98%",type="webservice"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="workhorse_git",type="webservice"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:confidence:ratio_30m{component="workhorse_git",confidence="98%",type="webservice"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="workhorse_git",type="webservice"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:confidence:ratio_6h{component="workhorse_git",confidence="98%",type="webservice"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="workhorse_git",type="webservice"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

matcher.options: /6h Degradation SLO \(5% of monthly error budget\).*/
/1h Outage SLO \(2% of monthly error budget\).*/

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: workhorse_git SLI Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:confidence:ratio_1h{component="workhorse_git",confidence="98%",type="webservice"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_component_errors:confidence:ratio_5m{component="workhorse_git",confidence="98%",type="webservice"} > on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="workhorse_git",type="webservice"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_component_errors:confidence:ratio_1h{component="workhorse_git",confidence="98%",type="webservice"} > on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="workhorse_git",type="webservice"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_component_errors:confidence:ratio_30m{component="workhorse_git",confidence="98%",type="webservice"} > on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="workhorse_git",type="webservice"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_component_errors:confidence:ratio_6h{component="workhorse_git",confidence="98%",type="webservice"} > on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="workhorse_git",type="webservice"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.content:
### Description

Aggregation of git+https requests that pass through workhorse,
monitored via the HTTP interface.

For apdex score, we avoid potentially long running requests, so only use the info-refs
endpoint for monitoring git+https performance.



### Observability Tools
panels.title: Details

panels.title: Apdex attribution for workhorse_git Latency - per code

panels.description:
Kubernetes containers can have a limit configured on how much CPU they can consume in
a burst. If we are at this limit, exceeding the allocated requested resources, we
should consider revisting the container's HPA configuration.

When a container is utilizing CPU resources up-to it's configured limit for
extended periods of time, this could cause it and other running containers to be
throttled.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(container,pod,type) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (container,pod,type) (
        rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", type="webservice"}[5m])
      )
      /
      sum by(container,pod,type) (
        container_spec_cpu_quota:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", type="webservice"}
        /
        container_spec_cpu_period:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", type="webservice"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_cpu_limit component saturation: Kube Container CPU over-utilization

panels.description:
Records the total anonymous (unevictable) memory utilization for containers for this
service, as a percentage of the memory limit as configured through Kubernetes.

This is computed using the container's resident set size (RSS), as opposed to
kube_container_memory which uses the working set size. For our purposes, RSS is the
better metric as cAdvisor's working set calculation includes pages from the
filesystem cache that can (and will) be evicted before the OOM killer kills the
cgroup.

A container's RSS (anonymous memory usage) is still not precisely what the OOM
killer will use, but it's a better approximation of what the container's workload is
actually using. RSS metrics can, however, be dramatically inflated if a process in
the container uses MADV_FREE (lazy-free) memory. RSS will include the memory that is
available to be reclaimed without a page fault, but not currently in use.

The most common case of OOM kills is for anonymous memory demand to overwhelm the
container's memory limit. On swapless hosts, anonymous memory cannot be evicted from
the page cache, so when a container's memory usage is mostly anonymous pages, the
only remaining option to relieve memory pressure may be the OOM killer.

As container RSS approaches container memory limit, OOM kills become much more
likely. Consequently, this ratio is a good leading indicator of memory saturation
and OOM risk.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(type) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      container_memory_rss:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", type="webservice"}
      /
      (container_spec_memory_limit_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", type="webservice"} > 0)
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_rss component saturation: Kube Container Memory Utilization (RSS)

panels.description:
Puma thread utilization.

Puma uses a fixed size thread pool to handle HTTP requests. This metric shows how many threads are busy handling requests. When this resource is saturated,
we will see puma queuing taking place. Leading to slowdowns across the application.

Puma saturation is usually caused by latency problems in downstream services: usually Gitaly or Postgres, but possibly also Redis.
Puma saturation can also be caused by traffic spikes.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(type) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by(type) (avg_over_time(sum without (pid,worker) (puma_active_connections{type="webservice"})[1m:]))
      /
      sum by(type) (sum without (pid,worker) (puma_max_threads{pid="puma_master", type="webservice"}))
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: puma_workers component saturation: Puma Worker Saturation
